website_summaries.verdict: It won't win any awards for aesthetics, but this sturdy umbrella pole does its job well.
pros: 50 pounds when filled with water or sand
cons: A few have said it's prone to wobbling when filled with water, so sand might be a better alternative

customer_reviews.title: Strong & Sturdy - Stunning & Sleek!
customer_reviews.text: These are so cool. They look like they cost a fortune and they didn't. I fill mine with water and they hold a free standing umbrella with no problem. The best is the pole that holds the umbrella, it's strong, and I mean STRONG! Excellent Product & Purchase. Thanks :-)
customer_reviews.author: SY214Top Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Easy decorative solution.
customer_reviews.text: Filled almost full with water to allow in case of freezing expansion without cracking the plastic construction. Heavy, easily installed in less than 10 minutes, recent winds in excess of 40 MPH, no problem, umbrella collapsed and tied up as well as open, never moved from set position. Easy decorative solution.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Love it heavy when filled water hold a large umbrella ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it heavy when filled water hold a large umbrella in a wind with no trouble. Can't ask for more and a good price also.
customer_reviews.author: Hutch1

customer_reviews.title: Most cost effective heavy stand
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty big, but under a table, who cares? It looks fantastic. And it's 1/3 of the price of comparable weighing stands. Hold the umbrella in place and has a nice knob to tighten down to keep the umbrella from spinning when tilted. It's great!
customer_reviews.author: Ryfresh

customer_reviews.title: It worked beautifully. The stand held the huge umbrella perfectly and ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item to use with my 8' market umbrella for an outdoor craft show last weekend. It worked beautifully. The stand held the huge umbrella perfectly and kept us dry during rain showers and shaded us from the sun. I simply love it because it does what it was intended to do! Thank you for getting it to me so quickly too!
customer_reviews.author: Zardoz12

customer_reviews.title: Review pole dimensions
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t fit my umbrella. Read the specification carefully. I selected this product because I thought the range of pole diameters was the 1 1/2” to 2 3/4”. It actually only fits a 1 3/4” pole. The 2 3/4 dimensions is even less than the outer diameter, that is 2 1/4. I attached a couple photos starting with the 2in mark on my taper measurer to give you an understanding of the actual dimensions. “umbrella base stand Fits 1 1⁄2” Diameter – 2 3⁄4” Diameter pole with conversion accessory creating a tight umbrella hold with the patio umbrella Base ring.”
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly under picnic table
customer_reviews.text: We filled this up with 5 lbs of sand. Other reviews mentioned how difficult it was to fill through the small hole. I cut the bottom out of a water bottle. The water bottle screwed into the hole perfectly. We used a funnel in the water bottle and had it filled with sand in just a few minutes. We haven't had any high winds since receiving it but I feel confident it will easily hold a collapsed umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Hill

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: This works really well. I filled it with water and it is heavy enough to keep our umbrellas up in windy weather. It's a little ugly, but that part is hidden so it doesn't really bother me. Construction seems very sturdy and plastic keeps it from scratching my deck when moved. I think it's over-priced, but there's not many options out there. 5 stars for function. 3 stars for price and aesthetics.
customer_reviews.author: DIYBarbie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work filled with water!
customer_reviews.text: Not sturdy with water! We filled this up with water as soon as we got it, and once we put in the umbrella, it was swaying and tilting without any wind. With wind, it sways all over the place! It may work better with sand, but I'm very unhappy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Save your money for more sturdy and supportive stands
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 2 stars because of the price point. These stands do not hold the umbrellas very well; we have 7.5" umbrellas that just wobble around in the mount. It's frustrating to see that most of ours have tipped over by morning time with the slightest gust of wind. Lesson learned and I have switched to concrete stands that no longer tilt the umbrellas or fall over.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Becomes heavy when filled with water!
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a heavy umbrella base that could hold a nine to 10-foot umbrella outdoors and everything I found was in the $50 range. I was a bit skeptical about one I would need to fill with water, but sure enough, it works and becomes very heavy when filled to the brim. The appearance is as shown in the photos on Amazon. Ours is under a table with four chairs and the base does not interfere with the chair placement.
customer_reviews.author: San Antonio Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but
customer_reviews.text: Not good for my 11' tilt umbrella. In fact after filling it with water, I tried to open umbrella but it kept tipping over. Part of the issue is the edges are rounded, so it is easier to tip. This may work ok for a 9' umbrella. The fill hole is small so I was not going to spend an afternoon buying sand and filling. Good luck! It also is a bit on the bulky cheap looking side. Oh well, for the price if it works then not bad. Not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mr P

customer_reviews.title: Might be ok for very small umbrella
customer_reviews.text: The stand looks good, but the rounded sides means it doesn’t provide great stability. My umbrella will tip over in 15mph breezes even when it’s closed, and furled tight !
customer_reviews.author: KirkG

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: These are just downright awesome and so easy, They will out last any of the metal ones and the umbrellas fit tight and are held sturdily. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: walter hammock

customer_reviews.title: Large base. Looks good. Small fill hole.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this product is great. Its larger than I expected which is good since I needed something heavy and stable for an umbrella on a second story deck where the wind is sometimes a little brisk. The base was easy to assemble: just one screw in the base. I feel that the hole where you fill the base with material ( either water or sand) was too small. In my case I needed to fill with sand and the small hole made this difficult even with dry play sand. I would recommend this base to anyone looking for an umbrella base.
customer_reviews.author: Drmatt

customer_reviews.title: Umbrella weight
customer_reviews.text: It's nice that it hold the weight of the umbrella, but there is still a lot of movement in the wind. Also, it doesn't tighten enough to keep a large umbrella from spinning around. Main thing that I'm not pleased with is that the center pole support fills up with water when it rains and rusted the first time we used it. UPDATED 2019: AWFUL!! Product has warped and will not hold an umbrella at all. The bottom is actually rounded and tips. The center has rusted through. This is a terrible product and we will never order from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Kent K

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy
customer_reviews.text: I have had this umbrella base for over a month now and I can honestly say I love it. The other day we had a tornado that took out a big Branch from my tree but my table and umbrella was still standing. I filled this thing up with water it’s huge and not really eye catching but it’s worth it and you don’t think about the look of it once it’s under the table.
customer_reviews.author: Dedra

customer_reviews.title: Stable
customer_reviews.text: We live in an apartment and have a storage unit. We didn't want to lug a traditional heavy umbrella stand into the car and over to storage for winter. This is perfect! We'll just dump the water out and it is then so light you can pick it up with one hand! Didn't even know they made this kind of product! It's been totally stable, and we are up 3 floors with winds at times.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Callis

customer_reviews.title: Nice base. Fits well.
customer_reviews.text: Nice umbrella base. We ordered a new umbrella which had a larger diameter pole than our previous one - so we had to get a new base. This accommodated the 1 3/4" pole very well. Filled it with water (it holds ALOT of water) and tightened the bolt to the pole. This thing isn't going anywhere! I tried to lift the umbrella - and no way. This should work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: My umbrella falls over with every wind
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be ideal for my umbrella but with every wind it falls over. The last time the umbrella broke. It was an expensive one, over 200 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Ursula

customer_reviews.title: Durable and good quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with the product. Durable and better quality than I had expected. I filled it with sand and it holds up my 10 ft umbrella very well. We had a few windy days recently and my (closed)umbrella didn't budge (I had a different stand before and the umbrella flew off).
customer_reviews.author: MyThAi4u

customer_reviews.title: Nice base.
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble connecting the pole and the screw because the pole did not go through the base. If you have this problem, light tap the pole with a hammer and it will go right through the hole in the base. Then you can connect the pole to the metal plate and then screw them together.
customer_reviews.author: carolyn

customer_reviews.title: It inflated!
customer_reviews.text: The thing inflated! We filled it with water to weigh it down. And it must have heated in the sun and without vent holes it just ballooned out on all sides. Very unstable. Trash.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Good for your outdoor area
customer_reviews.text: Plastic. Worked great though. Didn’t feel like it was going to break any second. Looks like picture
customer_reviews.author: A. Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Works great! I filled mine with water and it is ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I filled mine with water and it is very sturdy yet easy to move. I would recommend this to anyone. My neighbors liked it so much they bought one for their umbrella as the metal one they had would blow over in the wind.
customer_reviews.author: J.P.

customer_reviews.title: Did not stand in thunderstorm
customer_reviews.text: Our umbrella fell during the thunderstorm. It was filled with water. Guess only water weight is not enough to survive stormy days. Probs need sand.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Bumpalog

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The umbrella base arrive on time. It is very easy to use and does the job well. We would recommend this base to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella base is light and easy to get into place and then fill with water to give it weight. Much easier to use that the metal or stone ones. Also will not rust and mar my patio.
customer_reviews.author: CVBullen

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: This is a great base for our sometimes windy waterfront home. We chose to fill it with sand, but I think water would sturdy an umbrella as well. It’s also very pretty - we got the bronze. For us, a vented umbrella is important, but maybe not so much with this well-designed stand.
customer_reviews.author: Steffi

customer_reviews.title: It leaks.
customer_reviews.text: I don't like that it leaks, but the weight is pretty good. I have had the umbrella blow down though, so not as good as I need. I just have it up on my deck with some winds, but not severe winds. I have it filled with water obviously, but maybe sand for others would work better. I don't know. Sand is not a possibility for me as I am disabled and can't lift that.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Hartmann

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the buy!
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to set up with water, works great and I will be able to hide it in my small apartment when the season is finished!
customer_reviews.author: cls

customer_reviews.title: Better than metal
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice product. You fill it with water or sand and you have a stable umbrella base. It beats extremely heavy wrought-iron kind but has look of metal.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: looks good not cheap ... does the trick my free standing umbrella has yet to fall
customer_reviews.author: Michelle G.

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my vacation home, this bar is way too big to look pretty. It's a nice design but overly sized. Can't return it due to 30 days return policy, some give 60 days to return. A shame it'll be left in my garage without using it.
customer_reviews.author: Aphrodite Teya Rios

customer_reviews.title: A good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the purchase. The color goes well with my table and chairs and the size is a perfect fit under the table. I like being able to fill with sand or water. I would buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Liljestrand

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Holder for the Cost
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little umbrella holder! It's a great weight when filled with water. It looks nice under our wrought iron table. If you're looking for a durable holder that's not terribly pricey, this is for you! It will hold the umbrella steady even in a slight wind.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: stays put even though it's very windy recently, and i cant be bothered to close the umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great umbrella base
customer_reviews.text: This base is perfect for on the deck, filled with sand it is more than heavy enough that we don't have to worry about the umbrella falling over.
customer_reviews.author: Bulldogs forever

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good looking. Heavy enough with water for normal breezes. 30mph and up, remove the umbrella from the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Stella

customer_reviews.title: Just so so
customer_reviews.text: I have 9’ foot umbrella free stand. This base does not hold up to any slight wind. Im returning. I gurss u get what u pay for
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best umbrella base yet.
customer_reviews.text: Best umbrella base yet. This is the third or fourth base purchased over the years. This one works the best to keep the umbrella from falling down from the wind.
customer_reviews.author: E. Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Hole too small
customer_reviews.text: We haven't used it with our umbrella yet, so I can only comment on the filling process. In order to use sand, the hole is entirely too small. We even used a funnel and still struggled.
customer_reviews.author: Trista

customer_reviews.title: missing part
customer_reviews.text: Tube is spinning in the base I can't find part C
customer_reviews.author: Maxmin Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Maybe weighs 25lbs when filled with water. Maybe.
customer_reviews.text: Does not weigh 50lbs when filled. Clearly weighs less than my old one which says it weighs 35lbs. A faint breeze blew the umbrella over while the umbrella in the old stand was still standing. They lie.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Stable stand
customer_reviews.text: Filled it with water and stuck a 9ft umbrella in it. No leakage but not as heavy as I expected. Relative easy to move.
customer_reviews.author: NostalgicMom

customer_reviews.title: Works but not with 15 mph wind using water as filling.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this keeps tipping over in just 15 mph wind while the umbrella is down and not even extended. We used water to fill and may have to try sand.
customer_reviews.author: iVurbs

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit wobbly, I actually put some hockey tape around the end of my umbrella that inserts into the stand to give it a little more stability.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Eater didn't work well. But the umbrella I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Eater didn't work well. But the umbrella I have is very big. Keeps falling over
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and easy to set up. Exactly what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Love this umbrella stand! My second one.
customer_reviews.text: I own a food tuck and use this for my umbrella that’s nestled into a table that I built. It’s so very convenient, and looks lovely!
customer_reviews.author: Momma Can Cook

customer_reviews.title: Very solid, well built and inexpensive. Weighed 47 Lbs filled with water on my scale
customer_reviews.text: Just 1 heavy screw attaches base to holder with hex wrench tool provided in box, (it took me just 30 seconds to fully assemble). Very heavy when filled with water. (took 60 seconds to fill). you don't have to use sand...water weight is heavy. NOTE: Good idea to set in place before filling.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzy

customer_reviews.title: good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I had tried to previous umbrella bases and they did not fit my umbrella quite right. This one was extremely easy to setup and filling with water after putting it in the right location kept it from being too heavy to carry. My only complaint is that it would have been nice to have more detailed instructions. Took a bit to figure out what pieces we needed.
customer_reviews.author: g barnes

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. We have strong winds here in Miami and ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. We have strong winds here in Miami and a lot of rain. But I wanted something that I could easily move during hurricane season- this fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Sobe Prof

customer_reviews.title: Works As Advertised. Keeps rectangular 10ft umbrella in place in windy conditions
customer_reviews.text: We have a 10ft rectangular umbrella and this is the first stand that seems to hold the umbrella in place in mildly windy days.
customer_reviews.author: MaryMN

customer_reviews.title: Even though you fill it with water it still will ...
customer_reviews.text: Even though you fill it with water it still will tip over in a wind. Where you tighten the umbrella to the stand makes a dent and umbrella tilts.
customer_reviews.author: alice russell

customer_reviews.title: Great Umbrella Base!
customer_reviews.text: My husband searched several stores before deciding to purchase this umbrella base. It is perfect for our needs and nicely priced. It is somewhat time consuming to fill with sand but still a great choice. If we had to do it all over again, we would purchase this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Kat V

customer_reviews.title: Loved the fact it can be filled with water
customer_reviews.text: Loved the fact it can be filled with water. One of the reviewers noted that a water bottle (bottom removed) can be used as a funnel. That should be added to the printed instructions. So far, it has kept our large umbrella in place.
customer_reviews.author: NRG in PA

customer_reviews.title: Post collar is too short
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to fill the base with water, but it still leaves my 9' umbrella a little wobbly in the wind. I wish the collar to hold the umbrella post is a little taller for steadier hold.
customer_reviews.author: Kinna

customer_reviews.title: Horrible, the umbrella spins around
customer_reviews.text: This stand doesn't help, the metal part that goes through the donut hole that the umbrella sits in, spins around when the wind blows, very poorly made, DO NOT BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works great looks great
customer_reviews.text: Works great looks great. Sits on a breezy balcony in Southern California. Was concerned the winds we get would be too much for it, but it does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Everything is perfect with it...only the deliverer entered wrong information and said I rejected and returned it - which I did not...I contacted Amazon and they notated that it was delivered and consumer is happy with product.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Will be easy to store over the winter
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what it says it will be and works very well. Will be easy to store over the winter!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: I need to put sand in it. The water is not heavy enough for Houston winds.
customer_reviews.author: Ronda S. Archer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Well
customer_reviews.text: I've used water in my stand which is on a deck. It is working and I just roll it to move it to anther spot. I've had it since early summer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris J

customer_reviews.title: Works ok
customer_reviews.text: Does the job even if it is a little wobbly.
customer_reviews.author: PAC

customer_reviews.title: Good looking base
customer_reviews.text: Good looking base. The hole is small (could have been larger) and probably difficult to fill in the sand as some reviewers have noted, but if you are filling with water using a kettle or funnel it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: H. Uchida

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Expected better stabilization for the price. No different than other water/sand bases. I have a 11ft umbrella and still have to put the umbrella down with any storms.
customer_reviews.author: JMC

customer_reviews.title: Rusted through
customer_reviews.text: Bolt connecting tube for umbrella to base rusted through and broke within three months.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Not for use in high wind
customer_reviews.text: Does not hold up well to strong winds. Would work well as a base underneath a patio table, but not as a standalone.
customer_reviews.author: John Wisdom

customer_reviews.title: UMBRELLA STAND.
customer_reviews.text: IT IS SUFFICIENT FOR HOLDING UP THE UMBRELLA. IT ISN'T AS STEADY AS I WOULD LIKE. THE POLE DOESN'T FIT AS TIGHT AS I LIKE BUT IT HASN'T BLOWN AWAY YET. IT LOOKS NICE AND PERHAPS FILLING IT WITH SAND WILL INCREASE THE STABILITY BETTER THEN WATER.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Gagnon

customer_reviews.title: It can be drained so lightweight
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice. The best part about it is that you can drain it if you want to store it elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: M. Perlmutter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Woks to keep our umbrella upright, except in real high winds.
customer_reviews.author: Musikdr

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the 2 umbrella stands
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the 2 umbrella stands. I put them at the edge of the pool for shade. Every other stand I've used has always blown into the pool during afternoon winds. Not with these. I haven't had to fish a waterlogged umbrella out of the water since using these.
customer_reviews.author: P. McNutt

customer_reviews.title: Good and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a tough and sturdy base. It is not attractive, but then it is under a table. It was easy to fill,with water and is still full after several months. Due to the wind we often have to tip it over and no water leaks out. One problem, the plastic inside henhouse where you put the umbrella stem is not well crafted and keeps the umbrella from dropping all the way down to the ground, as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Aaannn1

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, left umbrella open in stiff wind ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, left umbrella open in stiff wind, it didn't move. Filled with water, but as it could freeze during the winter added 2 gallons on anti-freeze.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Umbrella base definitely up the job!
customer_reviews.text: I fulled mine with water and it worked excellently. I emptied it for winter storage, but it looks like this base will give me years of good service.
customer_reviews.author: Avalon100

customer_reviews.title: The price was reasonable
customer_reviews.text: I gave to my daughter for her kids when they go to the lake or river
customer_reviews.author: John m barbosa

customer_reviews.title: nice and seems to be fairing better then the last ...
customer_reviews.text: nice and seems to be fairing better then the last that broke in half some how.... this material seems way better.
customer_reviews.author: Flat Floors Tile

customer_reviews.title: it is not super heavy and umbrella go down in case of
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was heavy enough but even full of water, it is not super heavy and umbrella go down in case of wind
customer_reviews.author: Matthieu

customer_reviews.title: It was missing the main screw to assemble the bottom!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed it was missing the main screw (E) please send me the screw and I can put this together!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Susanne

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We filled this with water and it hasn't leaked or moved since-
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa S.

customer_reviews.title: So much better than the other base I'd purchased
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the other base I'd purchased. I will definitely be getting this one again when my other crappy one officially dies.
customer_reviews.author: E Cal

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, fits my larger diameter umbrella pole. Plastic base doesn't scratch deck.
customer_reviews.author: David F.

customer_reviews.title: I really like that the umbrella base can be filled with either ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like that the umbrella base can be filled with either water or sand, we filled base with water so that we could empty base for storage.
customer_reviews.author: SB Mom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Worked as expected, easily drained and stored... goodbye metal/concrete bases
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, easy to set up and fill with water--good price.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Mulligan

customer_reviews.title: Big and well built
customer_reviews.text: Big and well built. Took awhile to load with sand, but nice and heavy now.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Like it’s moveable and sturdy to hold a portable spinning close line,
customer_reviews.author: Ge123

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The product is as advertised, and as described by other positive reviewers.
customer_reviews.author: tailerwannabe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to move
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact you can fill it with water and it stays put. even in the wind without a table it stays. then when you want to move it you just drain the water and carry it to the new spot!!! #easygo
customer_reviews.author: G. Richard Poe

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for me on umbrella it was suggested for, returned...
customer_reviews.author: Shop-a-holic!!!

customer_reviews.title: Solid Base
customer_reviews.text: Solid weight to keep umbrella in place. It does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Love it ❣️
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! Very easy to empty and take we us!
customer_reviews.author: Janice L. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: We are very pleased with the base
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased with the base, filled it with water and it withstood very high winds with our large market umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Lee & Sue Bartman

customer_reviews.title: Holding pole would not go through to the bottom of ...
customer_reviews.text: Holding pole would not go through to the bottom of the base (as shown in the instructions). Stopped halfway due to the construction of the product. Tried everything to fix it. Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Love to read

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with it now just waiting for my umbrella to come in so I can use it
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Brast

customer_reviews.title: Just as described and works great for our umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Just as described and works great for our umbrella. Easy to put together and seems plenty heavy to hold umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: D. Horning

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, just what I wanted. Beautiful bronze color, filled it with water and it's totally sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: mary kay sevier

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Put water in the base, heavy duty and holds the umbrella up. So far no trouble
customer_reviews.author: SAW

customer_reviews.title: Iron alternative
customer_reviews.text: Nice alternative to iron. Only had for a few months but we’ll see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: EasyGoProducts EGP-BASE-004 Umbrella Base-Water Filled Stand-Outdoor Patio Market-Heavy Duty
feature_bullets: Decorative and versatile - easy go 50 pound umbrella Base can be used as a patio umbrella Base stand, deck umbrella Base, market umbrella Base, or as any outdoor umbrella base. This base is aesthetically pleasing and a great addition to your garden or deck!
Strong and durable - our umbrella bases have a 22 liter capacity – 5. 8 gallons – weighs 48. 5 pounds if filled with water – 74 pounds of weight if filled with sand.
